name: qlax3i
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wceq(co(co(c0, chj, c1), chj, c2), co(c0, chj, co(c1, chj, c2)))

body.origin:
|- wceq(co(co(c0, chj, c1), chj, c2), co(c0, chj, co(c1, chj, c2)))
-| wcel(c0, cch)
-| wcel(c1, cch)
-| wcel(c2, cch)
body.pretty:
⊢ ((c0[vH]c1)[vH]c2)=(c0[vH](c1[vH]c2))
⊣ c0 ∈ CH
⊣ c1 ∈ CH
⊣ c2 ∈ CH

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(co(co(c0, chj, c1), chj, c2), co(c0, chj, co(c1, chj, c2)))
-| wcel(c0, cch)
-| wcel(c1, cch)
-| wcel(c2, cch)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ((c0[vH]c1)[vH]c2)=(c0[vH](c1[vH]c2))
⊣ c0 ∈ CH
⊣ c1 ∈ CH
⊣ c2 ∈ CH

comment: One of the equations showing ` CH ` is an ortholattice. (This corresponds to axiom "ax-3" in the Quantum Logic Explorer.) (Contributed by NM, 4-Aug-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
